# What is a coup? .tiny[(click the authors for the source)]

--

> ## "[T]he infiltration of a small but critical segment of the .Blue[state apparatus] which is used to displace the government from control of the remainder" <br> [Luttwak (1969, 12)](https://ia601700.us.archive.org/19/items/coup-detat-a-practical-handbook/Coup-d%E2%80%99%C3%89tat-A-Practical-Handbook.pdf#page=26.15)


--

> ## ".Blue[illegal] and overt attempts by the military or other elites within the .Blue[state apparatus] to unseat the sitting executive"<br> [Powell and Thyne (2011, 252)](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/0022343310397436)

# Patterns of Coups .tiny[(using Powell and Thyne (2011) data)]

```{r, fig.width=14, fig.align='center'}

library(vdemdata)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyr)

vdemdata::vdem %>%
  select(country_name, year, contains('coup')) %>%
  filter(year>1949) %>%
  filter(year<2021) %>%
  drop_na() %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  summarise(
    across(contains("coup") & where(is.numeric), ~ sum(.x, na.rm = TRUE)),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  dplyr::rename(coup = e_pt_coup,
                coup_attempt = e_pt_coup_attempts) %>%
  dplyr::select(year, coup, coup_attempt) -> data


# coup_long <- coup_year %>%
#   pivot_longer(cols = c(coup, coup_attempt),
#                names_to = "type",
#                values_to = "count")

library(ggplot2)

data %>%
ggplot(aes(x = year)) +
  geom_line(aes(y = coup, color = "Coup"), size = 4, alpha=0.75) +
#  geom_point(aes(y = coup, color = "Coup"), size = 2) +
  geom_line(aes(y = coup_attempt, color = "Coup Attempt"), 
            alpha=0.75, size = 4) +
#  geom_point(aes(y = coup_attempt, color = "Coup Attempt"), size = 2) +
  labs(
#    title = "Global Coup and Coup Attempts Over Time",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Number of Cases",
    color = "Event Type"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom",
        text = element_text(size=20)) +
  scale_color_manual(
    values = c("Coup" = "blue", "Coup Attempt" = "red")
  ) 


```

# Coup Proofing .tiny[(Sudduth 2017)]

--

## - A leader's strategies to .Green[weaken] the military's .pink[ability] to mount a coup.

--

- .Large[.orange[paramilitary] organizations (sitting outside of the usual command)]
--

- .Large[frequent .orange[rotation] of commanders]
--

- .Large[division of the military into smaller .orange[rival] branches]

--

## - Could be effective if the military .violet[does not react] (but they do `r fa("person-military-rifle", fill='#EBBEE9')`)

--

- .Large[leader-military strategic interactions: zero-sum game]
--

- .Large[Generals like to maintain the credible threat (to protect their .Blue[interest])]
--

- .Large[coup-proofing `r fa("arrow-right", fill='yellow')` coup, thus .red[less] coup-proofing: coup risk is already high]

---

# Counterbalancing (De Bruin 2020)

--

## - security forces .Green[independent] from the regular <br>military chain of command, located .pink[close] <br>to the capital

--

## - .orange[NOT] great at deterring a coup

--

## - effective at .red[reducing] coup success rates, <br>once attempted
--

- .Large[physical resistance]
--

- .Large[complicates coordination among plotters]
